solution.text:
\(1\over \sqrt3\)=tan(30) and \(\sqrt 3\over 2\)=sin(60)
sin(_{j}_A+_{{4*k}}_B)=sin(60) and tan(_{j}_A-_{{4*k}}_B)=tan(30)
_{j}_A+_{{4*k}}_B=60 and _{j}_A-_{{4*k}}_B=30
adding the above 2 equations we get _{{2*j}}_A=90
hence, A=\(90\over _{{2*j}}_\)=_{{90/(2*j)}}_

content.text:
sin(_{j}_A+_{{4*k}}_B)=\(\sqrt 3\over 2\) and tan(_{j}_A-_{{4*k}}_B)=\(1\over \sqrt3\)
Given that 0<_{j}_A+_{{4*k}}_B<90 and _{j}_A>_{{4*k}}_B find the value of A
